sen.j: 汗衫（かざみ）とは、平安時代の貴族階級の女児用の薄手のトップス (衣服)。
sen.e: Kazami is a lightweight top (clothing) for girls of the noble class during the Heian period.
Kazami is a lightweight top (clothing) for girls of the noble class during the Heian period.
Kazami is a lightweight top (clothing) for girls of the noble class during the Heian period.

sen.j: 元来は汗取りとして着用されたものであった。
sen.e: Originally, it was worn as a garment for absorbing sweat.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Originally, it was worn as a garment for absorbing sweat.
Originally, it was worn as a garment for absorbing sweat.

sen.j: しかし、軽便な上着として子供服に採用されて高級化し、貴族女児の正装となった。
sen.e: However, it was used as a light outerwear in children's clothing but it was made into a luxury item, and it became a formal clothing for girls of the noble class.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, it was used as a light outerwear in children's clothing but it was made into a luxury item, and it became formal clothing for girls of noble class.
However, it was used as a light outerwear in children's clothing but it was made into a luxury item, and it became formal clothing for girls of noble class.

sen.j: 宮中儀式に伺候する童女などに用いられる豪華な上着。
sen.e: It is a luxurious outerwear used by young girls serving as attendants in ceremonial rites of the imperial court.
It is a luxurious outerwear used by young girls serving as attendants in ceremonial rites of the imperial court.
It is a luxurious outerwear used by young girls serving as attendants in ceremonial rites of the Imperial Court.

sen.j: 形は武官の袍と同様で裾が長い。
sen.e: It is long and its shape is the same as that of a military officer's outer robe.
It is long and its shape is the same as that of a military officer's outer robe.
It is long and its shape is the same as that of a military officer's outer robe called "ho" (outer robe).
sen.cmt: 袍 を追加しました。

sen.j: 襟を内側に折って垂領に着る。
sen.e: The collar is folded inside and worn in the tarikubi style (wrapped in the front with a V-shaped neckline).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The collar is folded inside and worn in the tarikubi style (wrapped in the front with a V-shaped neckline).
The collar is folded inside and worn in the tarikubi style (wrapped in the front with a V-shaped neckline).

sen.j: したがって、正面から見たところは袿の様である。
sen.e: Therefore, it looks like an uchigi (ordinary kimono) when viewed from the front.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, it looks like an uchigi (ordinary kimono) when viewed from the front.
Therefore, it looks like an uchigi (ordinary kimono) when viewed from the front.

sen.j: しかし、脇の部分が縫われておらず胸元を寛げて着付ける。
sen.e: However, the sides are not sewn together and it is worn so that the front is open at the chest.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, the sides are not sewn together and it is worn so that the front is open at the chest.
However, the sides are not sewn together and it is worn so that the front is open at the chest.

sen.j: 前身頃の裾は一丈二尺、後身頃の裾は一丈五尺でどちらも凧の足のように後ろに長々と引きずって歩く。
sen.e: The front is about 3.6 m long and the back is about 4.5 m long, and when worn, both trail behind like streamers of a kite.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The front is about 3.6 m long and the back is about 4.5 m long, and when worn, both trail behind like streamers of a kite.
The front is about 3.6 m long and the back is about 4.5 m long, and when worn, both trail behind like streamers of a kite.

sen.j: 着用者が未成年者であるため、成人女性のような袿ではなくより丈の短い女児用の衵を重ねて着装する。
sen.e: Because the girl wearing it is underage, it is worn by layering a shorter akome (innerwear) for girls, unlike an uchigi for grown women.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Because the girl wearing it is underage, it is worn by layering a shorter akome (innerwear) for girls, unlike an uchigi for grown women.
Because the girl wearing it is underage, it is worn by layering a shorter akome (innerwear) for girls, unlike an uchigi for grown women.

sen.j: 通常布1・5幅分の袖を三分の一ほど裏に折り返して着装する（おそらく現代和服の肩裾揚げと似た目的で行われたものだろう）。
sen.e: It is also worn with the sleeves, which are normally made with 1.5 times the width of the fabric, folded back by about a third (this was probably done for the same purpose as tucking in the hem and the shoulders in the modern-day kimono).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is also worn with the sleeves, which are normally made with 1.5 times the width of the fabric, folded back by about a third (this was probably done for the same purpose as tucking in the hem and the shoulders in the modern-day kimono).

It is also worn with the sleeves, which are normally made with 1.5 times the width of the fabric, folded back by about a third (this was probably done for the same purpose as tucking in the hem and the shoulders in the modern-day kimono).

sen.j: 単と長袴は紅ではなく若さを表す濃色（紫）である。
sen.e: Hitoe (a single-layer kimono) and nagabakama (long hakama (divided skirt) whose hems trail on the ground) are purple that represents youth, instead of red.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Hitoe (a single-layer kimono) and nagabakama (long hakama (divided skirt) whose hems trail on the ground) are purple that represents youth, instead of red.
Hitoe (a single-layer kimono) and nagabakama (long hakama (divided skirt) whose hems trail on the ground) are purple that represents youth, instead of red.

sen.j: 束帯装束のように白い表袴を女性用の長袴の上に履く独特の着装方をとる。
sen.e: Like the sokutai (traditional ceremonial court dress) costume, a white outer hakama is worn over a women's nagabakama, which is a unique way of wearing it.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Like the sokutai (traditional ceremonial court dress) costume, a white outer hakama is worn over a women's nagabakama, which is a unique way of wearing it.
Like the sokutai (traditional ceremonial court dress) costume, a white outer hakama is worn over a women's nagabakama, which is a unique way of wearing it.

sen.j: これは、衣装が国風化する以前は宮廷に仕える女子も男子同様に下袴の上に表袴を身につけていた名残であるという。
sen.e: This style traces back to the days before the costume became fully adapted by the Japanese Imperial Court, when women serving at the Imperial Court wore an outer hakama over the inner hakama, just as the men did.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This style traces back to the days before the costume became fully adapted by the Japanese Imperial Court, when women serving at the Imperial Court wore an outer hakama over the inner hakama, just as the men did.

This style traces back to the days before the costume became fully adapted by the Japanese Imperial Court, when women serving at the Imperial Court wore an outer hakama over the inner hakama, just as the men did.

sen.j: 高貴な女児の宮廷出仕用の装いとしての格式を表現するものであるらしい。
sen.e: It seems to represent the formality of the attire for girls of noble birth when they begin to serve at the Imperial Court.
It seems to represent the formality of the attire for girls of noble birth when they begin to serve at the Imperial Court.
It seems to represent the formality of the attire for girls of noble birth when they begin to serve at the Imperial Court.

sen.j: 成立初期には男子の束帯のように石帯をしたり、髪型も「あげまき」という男児にも結われる形にし、より中性的であった。
sen.e: When this costume was first established it had more of a neutral form, such as wearing a sekitai (a type of sash) like men's sokutai and styling the hair in 'agemaki' (locks of hair looped and tied above the ears), a form also worn by boys.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処,成立初期は何の成立か不明。衣装の成立として訳しました。
sen.e: When this costume was first established it had more of a neutral form, such as wearing a sekitai (a type of sash) like men's sokutai and styling the hair in 'agemaki' (locks of hair looped and tied above the ears), a form also worn by boys.

When this costume was first established it had more of a neutral form, such as wearing a sekitai (a type of sash, made of leather) like men's sokutai and styling the hair in 'agemaki' (locks of hair looped and tied above the ears), a form also worn by boys.
sen.cmt: 石帯 補足を追加しました。

sen.j: しかし、中期以降には髪型は「垂髪」、帯も汗袗と同生地で仕立てられた当て帯となり、成人女性の装いに近いものとなった。
sen.e: However, after the mid period of the costume's establishment the attire became closer to that of a grown woman, for example, the hair was worn in 'taregami' (long, flowing hair) style, and the sash became ateobi made of the same material as the kazami.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処, 「垂髪」は「タレが美」、「水発」、「すべらかし」等との読み方があるようです。当て帯定訳不明
sen.e: However, after the mid period of the costume's establishment the attire became closer to that of a grown woman, for example, the hair was worn in 'taregami' (long, flowing hair) style, and the sash became ateobi made of the same material as the kazami.

However, after the mid period of the costume's establishment the attire became closer to that of a grown woman, for example, the hair was worn in 'taregami' (long, flowing hair) style, and the sash became ateobi made of the same material as the kazami.

sen.j: 成人男子の衣冠装束に相対するものとして、表袴と帯を略す「汗袗の宿直装束」という着付けもあった。
sen.e: As opposed to the grown men's ikan (traditional formal court dress) costume, there was a way of wearing the costume called 'kazami no tonoi shozoku' (kazami costume for overnight stay at the Imperial Court), in which the outer hakama and the sash were omitted.

As opposed to the grown men's ikan (traditional formal court dress) costume, there was a way of wearing the costume called 'kazami no tonoi shozoku' (kazami costume for overnight stay at the Imperial Court), in which the outer hakama and the sash were omitted.

As opposed to the grown men's ikan (traditional formal court dress) costume, there was a way of wearing the costume called 'kazami no tonoi shozoku' (kazami costume for overnight stay at the Imperial Court), in which the outer hakama and the sash were omitted.

tit.e: Ke no Kazami (informal or daily kazami)
Ke no Kazami (informal or daily kazami)
Ke no Kazami (informal or daily kazami)

sen.j: 貴族の童女に着られた普段着。
sen.e: This was an everyday wear worn by young girls of noble class.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This was an everyday wear worn by young girls of noble class.
This was an everyday wear worn by young girls of noble class.

sen.j: 日常着という性質上その資料は殆ど現存しない。
sen.e: Because it was an everyday clothing information on it is virtually nonexistent.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Because it was an everyday clothing information on it is virtually nonexistent.
Because it was an everyday clothing information on it is virtually nonexistent.

sen.j: しかし、扇面古写経にその形態が描かれておりそこから復元資料が製作されたこともある。
sen.e: However, its form is described in Senmen Koshakyo (ancient hand-copied sutra on a fan), and a replica has been created based on that.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, its form is described in Senmen Koshakyo (ancient hand-copied sutra on a fan), and a replica has been created based on that.
However, its form is described in Senmen Koshakyo (ancient hand-copied sutra on a fan), and a replica has been created based on that.

sen.j: 形状は、袿とほぼ同型だが対丈の上着で、切袴に単、女児用の衵を重ねて着る。
sen.e: The shape is almost the same as that of an uchigi, but it is a full-length outerwear, and it is worn layered with a kiribakama (ankle-length hakama), hitoe and a girls' akome.
The shape is almost the same as that of an uchigi, but it is a full-length outerwear, and it is worn layered with a kiribakama (ankle-length hakama), hitoe and a girls' akome.
The shape is almost the same as that of an uchigi, but it is a full-length outerwear, and it is worn layered with a kiribakama (ankle-length hakama), hitoe and a girls' akome.

sen.j: 夏向けのものには狩衣のように肩の部分が開いていて、甚平の肩口のように紐を通して結ぶ「ゆだち」タイプのものがある。
sen.e: For the ones for summer, there is the 'yudachi' type that is open at the shoulders, as in kariginu (informal clothes worn by court nobles), and uses a cord to tie the shoulder section just as the shoulders in a jinbei (informal summer clothes for men).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: For the ones for summer, there is the 'yudachi' type that is open at the shoulders, as in kariginu (informal clothes worn by court nobles), and uses a cord to tie the shoulder section just as the shoulders in a jinbei (informal summer clothes for men).

For the ones for summer, there is the 'yudachi' type that is open at the shoulders, as in kariginu (informal clothes worn by court nobles), and uses a cord to tie the shoulder section just as the shoulders in a jinbei (informal summer clothes for men).

sen.j: 袖括りのあるものも存在する。
sen.e: There is also a type that has sodekukuri (straps used to turn up the cuffs).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There is also a type that has sodekukuri (straps used to turn up the cuffs).
There is also a type that has sodekukuri (straps used to turn up the cuffs).

tit.e: Kazami for Modern Day Shinto Rituals
Kazami for Modern Day Shinto Rituals
Kazami for modern day Shinto rituals
tit.cmt: 小タイトル用に小文字にしました。

sen.j: 晴の汗袗から発展したもので、近世の宮廷行事から近代の神事に用いるようになった。
sen.e: It developed from Hare no Kazami, and it is used in occasions varying from modern court functions to modern Shinto rituals.
It developed from Hare no Kazami, and it is used in occasions varying from modern court functions to modern Shinto rituals.
It developed from Hare no Kazami, and it is used in occasions varying from modern court functions to modern Shinto rituals.

sen.j: 縹色の裾の長い袍のような衣装である。
sen.e: It is a pale blue costume that looks like a long ho (outer robe).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is a pale blue costume that looks like a long ho (outer robe).
It is a pale blue costume that looks like a long ho.
sen.cmt: 袍 既出のため、補足を削除しました。

sen.j: 二藍の下襲を付け、表袴を履くのは平安のころと同じである。
sen.e: It is worn with a futa-ai (bluish purple obtained by dyeing with both deep red and indigo blue) shitagasane (long inner robe) and an outer hakama, just as in the Heian period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is worn with a futa-ai (bluish purple obtained by dyeing with both deep red and indigo blue) shitagasane (long inner robe) and an outer hakama, just as in the Heian period.
It is worn with a futa-ai (bluish purple obtained by dyeing with both deep red and indigo blue) shitagasane (long inner robe) and an outer hakama, just as in the Heian period.

sen.j: しかし、下袴は濃色の長袴ではなく男子同様の紅の大口袴を履く。
sen.e: However, the hakama worn underneath is not a nagabakama, but a red oguchibakama (wide-leg hakama, pleated and divided skirt made in fine stripes) just as the men do.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, the hakama worn underneath is not a nagabakama, but a red oguchibakama (wide-leg hakama, pleated and divided skirt made in fine stripes) just as the men do.
However, the hakama worn underneath is not a nagabakama, but a red oguchibakama (wide-leg hakama, pleated and divided skirt made in fine stripes) just as the men do.

sen.j: 絲鞋を履く。
sen.e: Shigai shoes are also worn.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Shigai shoes are also worn.
Shigai shoes are also worn.

sen.j: 髪型も活動の邪魔になるので古式の垂髪ではない。
sen.e: The hairstyle is not the old-fashioned taregami, because the hair will interfere with the activities.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The hairstyle is not the old-fashioned taregami, because the hair would interfere with the activities.
The hairstyle is not the old-fashioned taregami, because the hair would interfere with the activities.

sen.j: 左右のお下げを輪にして耳のうえで赤い紙でとめた「あげまき」にする。
sen.e: Agemaki' is used, in which the hair is parted and the locks of hair on the left and the right are looped and tied with red paper strings above the ears.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Agemaki' is used, in which the hair is parted and the locks of hair on the left and the right are looped and tied with red paper strings above the ears.
A style called 'agemaki' is used, in which the hair is parted and the locks of hair on the left and the right are looped and tied with red paper strings above the ears.
sen.cmt: 文頭に一部追加しました。
